overview: From 2026-01-22 to 2026-01-23, elizaos-plugins/registry had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Add Cerebras Plugin
topPRs.author: Xayaan
topPRs.body:
**Cerebras AI Plugin** Fast LLM inference plugin using Cerebras AI's industry-leading inference API. No local GPU required. Includes support for: - Advanced reasoning capabilities (GLM, Qwen, GPT-OSS models) - Strict JSON schema validation for structured outputs - All latest Cerebras models including zai-glm-4.7 Key Features - Direct Cerebras API integration via OpenAI-compatible format - Reasoning support with configurable depth (low/medium/high) - Structured outputs with strict JSON schema validation - Multiple models: Llama 3.3, Qwen 3, GLM 4.7, GPT-OSS 120B - No GPU required - cloud inference at 2000+ tokens/sec Why This Plugin? Enables blazing-fast LLM inference without expensive GPU infrastructure. Cerebras delivers the fastest inference speeds in the industry, making your ElizaOS agents more responsive and cost-effective. # Registry Update Checklist Registry: - [Y] I've made the left side of the colon of JSON entry in index.json match the potential NPM package name - [Y] I've used github not github.com - [Y] There is no .git extension - [Y] It's placed it alphabetically in the list - [Y] I've dealt with commas properly so the list is still valid JSON If not an eliza-plugins official repo, i.e. new plugin: The plugin repo has: - [Y] is publically accessible (not a private repo) - [Y] uses main as it's default branch - [Y] I have include `elizaos-plugins` in the topics in the GitHub repo settings. If the plugin is related to `AI` or `crypto`, please add those as topics as well. - [Y] add simple description in github repo - [Y] follows this convention ``` plugin-name/ ├── images/ │ ├── logo.jpg # Plugin branding logo │ ├── banner.jpg # Plugin banner image ├── src/ │ ├── index.ts # Main plugin entry point │ ├── actions/ # Plugin-specific actions │ ├── clients/ # Client implementations │ ├── adapters/ # Adapter implementations │ └── types.ts # Type definitions │ └── environment.ts # runtime.getSetting, zod validation ├── package.json # Plugin dependencies └── README.md # Plugin documentation ``` - [ ] an `images/banner.jpg` and `images/logo.jpg` and they - Use clear, high-resolution images - Keep file sizes optimized (< 500KB for logos, < 1MB for banners) - Follow the [elizaOS Brand Guidelines](https://github.com/elizaOS/brandkit) - Include alt text for accessibility - [ ] package.json has a agentConfig like the following ```json { "name": "@myNpmOrg/plugin-example", "version": "1.0.0", "agentConfig": { "pluginType": "elizaos:plugin:1.0.0", "pluginParameters": { "API_KEY": { "type": "string", "description": "API key for the service" } } } } ```

Greptile Summary

- Adds new Cerebras AI plugin (`@elizaos/plugin-cerebras`) to the registry for fast LLM inference capabilities without local GPU requirements - Maps the plugin to `github:Xayaan/plugin-cerebras` in the correct alphabetical position in `index.json`

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Added `@elizaos/plugin-cerebras` entry mapping to external repository; requires verification of plugin repository structure |

Confidence score: 4/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk but requires verification of external repository compliance - Score reflects proper JSON formatting and registry conventions but deducted one point due to missing plugin branding assets noted in the checklist - Pay close attention to the external repository at `github:Xayaan/plugin-cerebras` to verify it meets all ElizaOS plugin standards

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant GitHub participant Registry participant Scripts participant NPM User->>GitHub: "Create PR with updated index.json" GitHub->>GitHub: "Run automated validation checks" User->>GitHub: "Merge PR" GitHub->>Scripts: "Trigger generate-registry workflow" Scripts->>Registry: "Read index.json" Scripts->>GitHub: "Query repo info for @elizaos/plugin-cerebras" Scripts->>NPM: "Query package metadata" Scripts->>Scripts: "Process compatibility checks" Scripts->>Registry: "Update generated-registry.json" Registry->>Registry: "Commit updated registry files" ``` ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added Cerebras plugin support, expanding available integrations for the platform. ✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

topContributors.summary: madjin: Focused on critical bug fixes, resolving issues such as null contributor summaries (elizaos/elizaos.github.io#228) and missing API exports (elizaos/elizaos.github.io#225), and also merged a fix to re-export stats after contributor summaries are generated (elizaos/elizaos.github.io#229), primarily impacting bugfix work and configuration.
